alert.note: Alert for Edgefield; Fairfield; McCormick; Newberry; Saluda (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 03 at 8:03PM EST by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of north central McDuffie, northern Columbia, Lincoln, western Fairfield, Newberry, Edgefield, Saluda and McCormick Counties through 900 PM EST... At 803 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Monarch Mill to near Joanna to near Ninety Six to near Washington. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Newberry, VC Summer Nuclear Station, Martinez, Edgefield, Saluda, McCormick, Johnston, Lincolnton, Whitmire, Prosperity, Clarks Hill Recreation Area, Elijah Clark State Park, Mistletoe State Park, Monticello, J. Strom Thurmond Dam, Blair, Jenkinsville, Riverwood, Hamilton Branch State Park and Saluda County Airport. This includes Interstate 26 between mile markers 62 and 88. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until these storms pass.
